Activates help mode for instruction on how to use this App.

Welcome to TUM Campus App!

In order to setup the TUMOnline access, you need to provide your LRZ Identification.

This Id has the following format:
xx00xxx
(2 letters, 2 digits, 3 letters)

The TUMOnline-Access-Token was successfully generated\n\nYou can now enable the Token in TUMOnline via Services/Token-Management. Make sure the rights you want to gain the App are set as well under Active Rights.
Activate or deactivate Silent Service. If activated, the device will go into silent mode if a lecture appointment has been recognized.
Activate or deactivate Background Mode. If activated, content will be fetched once per day to keep your TUM Campus App up to date.
Problems with internet connection, please try again later

Swipe left or right to hide a card.
If you want to hide a card permanently or you want to be notified if a new card is available open card-settings by long pressing on a card

TUM Campus App
The TUM Campus App is developed by students of the Android practical course, other voluntary freelancers and chair members. 

Project Management:
TUM - Computer Science / F13 
Prof. Dr. Uwe Baumgarten 
Nils T. Kannengiesser 

Most recent Developers: 
Jana Pejic 
Marko Lalic 
Kordian Bruck 
Florian Dreier 
Sepideh Mesbah 
Shabnam Najafian 

Further Developers: 
Sascha Moecker, Haris Iltifat, Anas Chakfeh, Thomas Krex, Marius Muntean, Christoph Richter, Thomas Bley, Vincenz Dölle, Daniel Mayr, Thomas Behrens, Florian Schulz, Vasyl Malinskyi, Andreas Bernhofer (IT-Support/TUMonline), Nils T. Kannengiesser (F13) 

UX Testing: 
Xenia Eifler 

Important information:
This App is not published by the Technical University Muenchen officially. It is a project by and for students. The software is used at your own risk. We are not responsible for any damage that might be caused by using this App or its presented information. For security reasons the access to private information of TUMOnline is regulated by using tokens. You need to enable different features within TUMOnline for a certain token to be able to use those information within the App. 

Privacy information:
The application stores data on request only. Critical information requires the user's permission (clearance by token) and is stored locally or received from TUMOnline directly. We are using BugSense for bug tracking. Crash reports contain detailed technical information on the phone, the operating system and the error itself. This information is helpful for the developers in order to improve the app. Furthermore BugSense collects anonymous usage information (e.g. users of the app per day). Detailed information on BugSense can be found below. 

Support:
https://www.facebook.com/TUMCampus 
Please take a look at the offered manual as well. In addition please contact us at tca-support.os.in@tum.de for any special requests. 

Licenses:
GNU GPL v3 - http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html or 
New BSD License - http://www.opensource.org/licenses/bsd-license.php 

The source code is available on GitHub (https://github.com/TCA-Team/) 

TUM Campus App on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/TUMCampus 

Detailed information on BugSense:
BugSense will not collect any sensitive user data, but gathers the following information (as provided by the BugSense support team):

On Session start:
Unique device identifier (random string), App version, OS version, Device model, Locale, Timestamp, Event type, SDK version

When an exception occurs:
Stacktrace, Error message, App version, OS version, Device model, Locale, Timestamp, SDK version, GPS on/off/NA, WiFi on/off, Cellular data on/off, Device orientation, Screen size, Uncaught or handled exception, custom data

Furthermore it collects the user ip, user country, date/time of crash and application date. BugSense may use the collected information for various general purposes like products and services provision, error analysis, identification and authentication, services improvement, contact, and research. They may publish aggregated and anonymized reports, too.


May 9th 2014
Query must be at least %d chars long
Shows you the departure times of public transport
Shows information about your next lecture
Reminds you if you have to pay your fees
Notifies you if new messages are available
To receive notifications on your phone you have to enable Wearable
Do you want to connect to eduroam now?
Click to start setting up eduroam
Allows you to easily set up eduroam wifi connection
To set up the wireless access a PIN lock is required. If you don\'t already use PIN lock you can set it up here. More Info

For safety reasons, the data backup must be disabled to avoid that the LRZ credentials are stored unencrypted on the Google servers. Under \'Backup & restore\' > \'Back up my data\' to disable. More Info
Configuration failed!\nDid you setup a PIN-Lock?
You have to install a CA-Root-certificate to enable secure connection with server. Just click \'Install certificate\' and confirm with \'OK\'.
The first start may take a few minutes
TUM Campus App does not save the password, but Android WifiManager does.
Shows only the latest article. Otherwise all articles of the selected sources are shown.
Activate or deactivate Lecture chat. If activated, you will be able to join lecture chat rooms, where you and your colleges can discuss.
Terms must be accepted to use group chat!
Please activate your public key first
Support the TCA Team by sending anonymous bug reports to our server which include: stack trace, logfile, android version, app version and screen resolution

Select which newspread you want to be shown. This are the slides on the info monitors in your faculty buildings.

Identity could not be accessed. Please check the rights of your TUMOnline token!
Public key activation mail sent to %s@mytum.de.\nPlease activate it now!
No private key found! Reset the app\'s data to solve this!
If you want to use lecture chat you will get an e-mail to activate your public key. In order to use it click the link provided in this e-mail.
Lectures could not be accessed. Please check the rights of your TUMOnline token!
If you subscribe for a new lecture the app will automatically add you to the lecture\'s chat room.
